summary: The 'Honoring Our Fallen Heroes Act of 2025' amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to provide public safety officer benefits for exposure-related cancers. It defines exposure-related cancers, establishes presumptions of injury related to carcinogen exposure, and allows for updates to the definition. The bill also amends the confidentiality of information and makes technical amendments to previous legislation, including the Safeguarding America’s First Responders Act of 2020.
